intro: Diplospora sorsogonensis, commonly known as the Mindoro balsam, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
